content.text: From mugshots to microscopes and surveillance to stains, this installation investigates the traces we all leave behind – the evidence of interactions with our environment and each other.

Inspired by aspects of ‘Forensics: The anatomy of crime’, a group of artists from Leyton Sixth Form College worked with photographer Edmund Clark to respond to the ideas of identity raised in the exhibition and have produced a body of work using elements of the forensic process.
What will you deduce about the identity of the artists when you examine their work?
From mugshots to microscopes and surveillance to stains, this installation investigates the traces we all leave behind.
